description:
Last night I walked across this resturant in search of a good place for dinner with some friends after watching a play at the golden gate theatre. I must say, it a sure win for a first try at this cozy, tasty and inexpensive resturant. On arrival there was an initial wait, but we ended up being seated speedily which was a good sign. The waiter was very sweet and took his time to explain our choices from the menu while giving us great suggestions. 
We started with a plate of banchan(Korean sides) then worked our appetites to all the rest of these amazing large meals:

Korean short ribs- tasty 
Kimchi fried rice
Potstickers- yummy 
Pot of spicy tofu with seafood soup(Amazing!!)
Sweet and spicy chicken wings- tasty 
Crystal noodles-tasty- yum
Fire spicy chicken w/ rice cakes 

My fav was the soup, I could stop eating it.

We were able to share all the plates amongst the four of us. At the end we were all completely stuffed with the yummiest n tastiest foods ever and our bill came out to less than $80 which was nothing in comparison to what we ate and was very impressive.

The only downside, which is really not much of one, is that there were no non alcoholic beverages except water. 

Will definately be going back for great food, ambience, service and awesome price.
author: Ivie O.

description:
Not much choice to eat at Downtown after midnight so we came here to eat late night on Sunday, 10.28.2018.  Fish cake soup was salty & so did the sauce of the Somen. 

****Check You Bill, You May Be Scam****

BEAWARE: I surprised my friend and gave the card to my server (the older male server). I went to bathroom before I signed my credit card.  I checked my bill and saw a 18% gratuity/tip was included. He didn't tell me gratuity is included.  We (2 people) shared 3 dishes. (Fish Cake Soup, Pancake & Somen) It's ashamed that the male server put 5 guests (circle in Blue) so that he can add tips (party 5 or more, gratuity is included). 

I checked my credit card voucher tip section left it BLANK.  At the bottom, there were suggested tips which suggested tip amount even more (it's based on the 18% tip + Order Total = amount circle in Red). This is so wrong and sneaky. I do tip when I go out to restaurants & bars since tips for servers & bartenders are part of their income. It's necessary to tip the servers & bartenders. It's upset that they don't even care about how their patrons feel about this scam and they continue doing so. (Hint: I am not the only victim) 

My receipt is attached, I had to write down "Included" in the Tip Section for both of the merchant & customer copy to indicate TIP IS INCLUDED in the bill. 

Definitely, I will not return to this restaurant again.
author: Neko N.

description:
This place is disgusting. The people are pretty racial and they did make racial remarks to me when I asked about something on the menu. What really pissed me off was when I simply asked for all sauces on the side since I am allergic to there sauce for some reason and they said no! Like what...

What disgust me was the waiter. Flat faced always wearing dark color. He asked me what what wrong after he pour sake and on me new shoes. It was like it never occurred to him what he did was so impolite and rude. Deeply sorry to say that the food is alright, but the hostility and environment really puts this place to shame. 

Lastly what's sick is that the woman making the food in the back kept picking her teeth without washing her hands. Gag.
author: Joseph V.

description: my Korean friend told me the food is authentic Korean food. You'll get a super spicy dish if you ask them to make the food spicy. They're open till 2 AM. Spicy pork is my Go-to dish and spicy tofu soup with beef is good. Love their soju fruit cocktails. Expect lines at night, be sure to join the waitlist on yelp app before you head out.
author: Madhu J.

description:
I'm a little upset that I actually spent the time and effort to walk here only to be disappointed. All I wanted was some Korean comfort food to end off the weekend; the gloomy weather made it the perfect evening for some soon tofu.

This restaurant is really dark. The interior is small and cozy, but it honestly gave me the heebie-jeebies due to how unclean everything felt. Probably good that the lights were dim. I can usually grit my teeth through these things if the food is bomb, but that wasn't the case this time.

I ordered what I came for (the soon tofu), and also a kimchi fried rice. I'll break each of these down...

The soon tofu didn't come with white rice. I suspected from the price point that it probably wouldn't, and I would be willing to pay a bit extra for that. The first thing I noticed was that the soup stopped bubbling almost right after it was set down on my table; I didn't get the hot and spicy sensation that warms you up. It was all sort of... lukewarm. No real flavour, as all I could taste was the spiciness, so it all felt a little flat. Almost tastes like something made from packaged soon tofu mix.

The kimchi fried rice... was also meh. Was also sort of warm, but not hot, and it definitely didn't taste like it was fried. Maybe cooked over medium heat. 

In general it just felt like these two items weren't  made with any care. At first, I was relatively excited about the low (relative to the rest of SF) menu prices, but after finishing, it feels like maybe the prices are a bit high for the quality and quantity that you get. Perhaps I ordered the wrong things, but this wasn't like ordering seafood at a steakhouse... this is ordering Korean food at a Korean restaurant.
author: Calvin Z.

description:
3/5
~Food~  
Half & Half Chicken (hot & tangy + sweet marinade): They come mostly boneless and if you're worried about spicy, they're not spicy. Overall, it was simple, nothing crazy, and I liked it.
Cheese Corn: Nothing crazy or new but cheese corn is my guilty pleasure
Kimchi Pancake: It tasted like a kimchi inspired pancake/the flavor was not very strong.
Army Soup: A good savior to the chilly SF evenings. The soup itself was good but there were so many sausages compared to the rice cake, ramen, etc.

~Price/Quality/Quantity~  
Chicken $16.95 - Half of the plate was cabbage. Although that was a nice combo, it was a little pricey for what it was. 
Cheese corn $7.95 - It was alright
Kimchi pancake $10.95 - small and thin
Army soup $13.95 - mostly very salty sausages

~Atmosphere/Service~
FYI CASH ONLY
Our waiter was helpful with questions we had for the menu but you will have to flag them down if you want to pay. The overall atmosphere was "kick it back with your buddies while chomping down beer & wings".

~Bottom Line~
Decent food and your hole in the wall Korean place that's slightly pricey but what other options do you have in Downtown.
author: Lily L.

description:
Come here if you're having the DRUNCHIES! 

I joined the waitlist on yelp so my table was almost ready by the time I got there! 

Came here really late at night, maybe around 1am? And this place was CROWDED. 

We got the seafood pancake, kimchi fried rice, corn cheese, some chicken wings & strawberry soju! At the time, everything tasted so so good!! But maybe because it was drunchies hours?? 

Anyways, I'll definitely come back again for that BOMB kimchi fried rice!
author: Ashli C.

description:
I came back from​ a long fun weekend-cation and my plane was coming late. Not many options, even in SF but I had a craving for Asian​ food that night and remembered that Cocobang had open late. Cool! Let's​ head there​. And with the new cool Yelp feature of a digital WaitList (VERY COOL GUYS!!!) I would not even have to wait that long this time, cause normally this place is packed anytime.

Ok, this time it wasn't​, maybe the reason why I​ change my formerly​​ good review​ to a "naja" one. 

First the good things, Portions are still so good. Even I could​ finish everything​.  And it is fast after you order. The Sweet Corn Cheese Plate is still a stable to go for - five stars for this. And also the free appetizers are so good! It is still a dive restaurant more a hole in the wall kind of thing but that is totally ok, it would be a great idea to reprint some of the menus cause they are pretty messed up. But other then that I can live with the surrounding. ​

But then came the chicken, which once was so good and I was sooo disappointed​ this time, I was so shocked I totally forgot to tip :( 
Sorry to the waiter you did a good job.... will make that up to​ you next time!

I had two different types of chicken the fried chicken with green onions. And the chicken in sweet tangy sauce. Both sauces have been good, But when it comes to the chicken it was as we got the bad part of the day. It was gooey (but not in a good way) not crispy (both parts) and with a lot of fat (more like a fat duck than​ a lean chicken) it was no pleasure to eat at all! I saw that the patron on the next table hat the same chicken and he had the same look on ​his face and was fighting​ with the pieces of chicken as well. He left more on the plate then he had eaten. 
So did I. 

I will come back, cause the first two times I have been here having been​​ just great, so I hope this was just a bad chicken day from the delivery farm! I will take the risk cause having a good Asian Grill at night is so important for this late night cravings. Please, guys,​ ​check your best Parts: the chicken.
author: Martin W.

description:
Such a great late night snack/meal option. The food is quick and delicious. I loved the army soup and the wings. I would say the Tteokbokki was ok, but not the greatest. The place is really tiny so there might be wait even at 1-2am. Overall loved coming here. 

Ambiance: 4/5
Food: 4/5
Service: 4/5
Overall Experience: 4/5
author: Elizabeth L.

description:
Don't get served by this guy. If he's serving DO NOT GO! I've been a loyal customer to this location for over 5 years. And i decided to go and this dude is there... I just asked him how long the wait is.... he looks at me and says "no... u wait like everyone else..." he also said "i don't care who u know or who works here...I'm here right now and I decide whether i serve you or not".. and I'm like.. I didn't say I knew anyone here, then he blows up and says I'm not serving you, leave restaurant now! 

WHAT DID I DO WRONG???? I just asked how long the wait is.

DO NOT GO HERE only if you see this guy working.

This place sucks if this guy is here!! 
He's the most rude guys ever!!
author: Justin S.

description: The worst service. Don't go here if you're looking for good Korean late night food. Rather go to Playground in Jtown than deal with the rude service. All I asked for is if my friend is working to say hi and this server says he's not serving me and to leave. Wtf?!? What kind of business demands for customers to leave? The food is mediocre and I'm Korean which says a lot. Only went here to support my friend. If you see this server just go elsewhere. It's not worth your time.
author: Ann K.

description:
There aren't too many places to go to in San Francisco to get that Korean food fix w/ soju. Cocobang is probably my preferred place and luckily they're on Yelp Nowait -- so you can skip the line! 

Every time I come here, I basically order wayyy too much, but everything is pretty affordable. Definitely get the half & half chicken, pork belly slices and the rice pinky's with ramen.
author: Young Y.

description:
Haven't been here since we moved to the East Bay but literally used to go here so often when we lived in the city!
Get the chicken!! There's not too many Korean restaurants in the city, so when I want some chicken and tofu soup, this is the place to go! 
Only con is the area cause it gets a little sketchy at night.
author: Alex C.

description: In the mood for Korean fried chicken, we went to Coco Bang.  Sounded and looked hip.  They have limited seating.  The service was OK.  The food was just OK.  The other Yelp reviews were right...this place was super loud.  People basically yelling and laughing out loud.  Mediocre food.  Good size portions though.  One time try for me.
author: Kevin B.

description:
Came in with a group of 5, they charged 20% gratituty, and cash only. They had an additional suggested tip... when we got the receipt. How is this ok?

Anyways... small restaurant. You can join the waitlist on the Yelp app. But wings were good- the sweet sauce marinated chicken was nice crunchy and sweet; wasn't really a fan of the fried chicken with half and tangy sauce though. Drums are boneless which I liked and there was only a few flats.
author: Melody W.

description:
Note: I ordered delivery 

I ordered from this place during a late night at work. I love Korean food so even ok Korean food is decent. This food was tasty but it was shockingly oil. I got the tofu soup and every time I had some, my spoon came out covered in oil. My colleague got the fried rice and chicken cutlet with sauce and he enjoyed both quite a bit. It was one of his first times eating Korean food and he enjoyed it so that's satisfying enough for me
author: Sharvari J.

description:
One of my favorite places to go for a late night meal if I'm in the downtown SF area. This place is fairly small and usually very crowded, even at late times (roughly 1AM or so), especially on the weekends. But worth the wait so I'd say check it out for some late night munchies. 

There's an ample selection of Korean food and you can't go wrong with a bit of yogurt soju on the side to share with friends. My group ordered the Korean chicken (sweet and and spicy sauce), kimchi fried rice, and budae jjigae. There's a good amount for a full order of the fried chicken, which is definitely recommended. Get half and half to try different flavors!  The egg on the kimchi fried rice was cooked perfectly, with just the right amount of yolk cooked. And the budae jjigae was one delicious stew of spam, ramen, and rice cakes. 

The music videos playing at this joint added a nice little vibe to the overall atmosphere of the place.
author: Karen Y.

description:
After reading the glowing reviews I was excited to give it a try. I ordered a 1/2 order of fried chicken and garlic fries. Ended up eating two of the 6 pieces of chicken and 1/4 of the fries. I was very disappointed.

I ate dinner at ZZAN yesterday (business trip) and it was 100% better than Cocobang. Go there instead. You're welcome. :)
author: Steve B.

description:
My boyfriend and I had a really great experience at this "hole in the wall" restaurant! Food was extremely delicious, friendly servers and overalls great customer services. We ordered mango icy soju, beer, kimchi fried rice, wings, a plate of half short ribs & beef.

The only downfall I was say about this place is that it's quite small. It was a little uncomfortable eating on a very small table with the amount of food we ordered . Definitely recommend this to anyone who loves Korean food during their late night adventures out in the city, because they close at 4am!
author: Jamie T.

description:
What a yummy place in San Fran!
Was craving some Korean food so we came here.
This place is definitely one of my favorite Korean restaurants in town.
They have a nice wide selection of Korean food.

I love their Korean drinks. 
We always order Somaek (), is a beer cocktail made with soju and beer.

The price is reasonable. 
Service is always good.
Location is perfect, 5 mins walking distance from union square.

Come early because they ALWAYS CROWDED. 
But you will know the food here is so worth to wait!
author: Naiyun W.

description: Holy s&@t this place is good! Yelp waitlist is perfect so you can show up and get a seat asap. The stews are phenomenal and the kimchi fried rice is excellent. Fried chicken was pretty good but not amazing, wings were a bit over cooked. OB and rice wine are perfect for this food. Not a lot of vegetarian options but oh well.
author: Ariel M.

description:
Came here for a late dinner around 10:30 pm on a Tuesday night and was surprised by how packed it was! We saw many parties eating and ordering soju, so the atmosphere was quite lively.

We ordered the beef tofu soup and bi bim bap to share. This came with free side dishes to start. There was fish cake (my fav!), pickled radish and pickled bean sprouts. It was a bit weird there was no kimchi but the sides were still delicious.

Both our soup and rice bowl cake pretty quickly. Soup was good- lots of tofu and great spicy pepper flavors. Bi bim bap was a bit more average. It came in a normal bowl and didn't really have a ton of meat in it. It was only $10.95 though, so can't complain too much. Overall both dishes were solid and even above average if you factor in the price.

Overall 4 stars due to price/food am being open late night.
author: Sophia H.

description:
FOOD IS GOOD BUT THE WAITER SPILLED MY HOT AF DISH ON MY LAP AND I STILL had to PAY FOR THE MEAL 

We came as a group of 8, and was seated after 15 min at a pretty cramped table. I split the spicy beef soondubu and the whole fried chicken (half tangy spicy/half sweet soy sauce) with my dinner partner. Both were delicious and I would highly recommend. 

The only problem is that since they seated us at a table too small for our indicated party size, there was little space to move and navigate a hot, boiling soup dish to the table without spilling some, onto my pants and the ground. I was disappointed that they still charged us for the dish and even the meal, because I pretty much have ruined jeans and probably a something degree burn on my thigh right now :( 

Hopefully the management will read my review and Do Something About It. Thanks.
author: RachEl L.

description: Double check your bill. Their food is OK. However the service is quite unfriendly and they will cheat you with the charges on the bill. In my case they increased the bill by over 35%. Amazing!
author: andrew v.

description:
Terrible service here but I am guilty of coming here late night to eat some fried chicken hehe. I also like to order the tofu soup which tends to be too spicy these days even when I ask for medium spicy! 

I recommend:
- fried chicken
- tofu soup
author: Alicia L.

description:
This place is pretty hit or miss for me in the few times that I've come here. Almost always come late at night, and if you're lucky there will not be a lineup. But if there is one, be prepared to wait at least 30 minutes.

I have sampled a lot of the things on the menu, and not a lot stood out to me that I could say was super good, but at the same time I can't remember any that I wouldn't order again. Actually I take that back, I'm a sucker for potstickers so I definitely really enjoyed those. Everything seems solid, and they give you a lot of water when you come in late night. Will be back when I'm in the area again most likely. Think I'll focus more on the fried chicken next time.
author: Rajeev S.

description: Food is not all that, soup was very salty taste like powder soup base, kimchi pancake wasn't spicy and I hardly see any kimchi in there besides the pancake itself... speechless
author: Foodie 4.

description:
"Korean food...in SF!"

As one of the few Korean places in the city, I had to give Cocobang a shot (get it? bang...shot!)

The first thing you'll notice is this place is pretty legit from the get go. You'll see KPOP playing in the background, Korean staff, and Korean writing all around the restaurant. Oh and of course, you'll also notice this place is a bit small. So don't think you can just waltz right in. You'll definitely have to wait a bit.

Once you get seated you'll be provided with your very own fully Korean menu. My friend did the ordering but there was a lot to choose from ranging from OG staples like tofu soup to more modern dishes. We ordered that tofu soup and threw in a spicy pork dish with cheese too (I never seen so much cheese in a Korean restaurant, but I guess that's just what the kids eat nowadays!). The banchan is fairly standard and you'll get about 3 things while you wait for the food to arrive. FUN BONUS: Yes, the water jug will be adorned with soju advertisements.

Overall this place is a great pregame spot. Prices and portions are about right. Service was pretty good and attentive too.

Protip: the food is legit spicy. Make sure to get some extra orders of rice to cut the heat.
author: Joel L.

description:
Check in at 8:50pm for table of 6. Waited about 40 mins until a table of 4 open up and a party of two just took the table when they just arrived. I ask the waiter how much longer because they gave up the our table when we were waiting for 45 mins already. 

The waiter said another 30 mins. At this point, I am leaving because it doesn't seem like to employee care about the customers as to which I left because my money is better somewhere else.
author: Kai P.

description:
Cocobang has hands down the best Korean fried chicken I've ever tasted. It's perfectly fried, with crisp but light breading and amazingly tender on the inside. I always go for the half & half order of the hot & tangy and sweet sauce flavors. 

Their bulgogi and kalbi dishes are also pretty good, but not my favorite in the city, and they've got delicious Soju cocktails as well. The space is very small, so expect a wait -- or get in line ahead of time on Yelp.
author: Matt G.

description:
I absolutely love this place. They can get pretty busy, but if you're like me and love a quality late night meal this place is perfect! The staff is nice and helpful! Food is always amazing!

The mango Soju pitcher is very light on the alcohol side, but who can beat $12 and great flavor with a spicy meal! Overall for 2 people we paid $39!
author: Vee D.

description: Stumbled upon this spot while walking through the streets of San Francisco looking for a place to eat for dinner.  Seating was a bit tight but they had old school R & B videos playing on a Big movie screen (My Favorite), food was AMAZING and service was Awesome! Being Full Korean....it tasted like Home! Two thumbs Up!
author: Loise S.

description:
Definitely one of my favorite Korean restaurants in SF, especially because they're  open late. I love being able to come here after a night out clubbing or bar hopping & they're always open.

Only thing I dislike, and I'm sure everyone who has been here can agree, that the wait can be super long for a table. The restaurant is so small that when there are big groups the majority of tables are taken.

All in all, I love their food! Everything I've had there has been so good & comes out in a timely manner. By far my favorite plate is the spicy BBQ short ribs. They really are amazing!
author: Ashley J.

description:
I've always been intrigued by Cocobang because everytime I pass it on my way home there always seems to be a line so I assumed it was crackin'.

Came here on a Saturday night around 7pm because I had a serious craving for Korean fare and was too lazy to make the trek out to Japantown. Got seated right away and I'm glad we did because 30 minutes later there was a line forming. This place must be popular because it's located in a heavily tourist area but I came with low expectations since it seemed like a drunk munchies / drunchies sort of establishment.

Ordered the kimchi fried rice, the fried chicken with green onion, the corn cheese. The kimchi fried rice was okay, it had big pieces of kimchi and hot dogs. I've had better Korean fried chicken elsewhere, this was mediocre at best. The corn cheese was good but again expectations were low because literally this was only corn and cheese and how could you mess that up?

I think I'd like this place more if I came drunk.
author: Connie M.

description:
BANGBANG. ALWAYS CROWDED BUT SO GOOD YOU HAVE TO GO. The most amazing chicken nuggos ever, and 3am drunk me can't get enough of it really . Even though it's a small hole in the wall restaurant, it packs a huge punch and the amazing visuals on the projector screen will have you hypnotized as much as the food. I'd go every time if there wasn't so crowded all the time, and Id suggest you try it once :) 
One thing to keep in mind however is the health score, but I don't really mind since the food is good.
P.S. I hate my friends who always eat the food before I take a picture to troll me.
author: Leo W.

description:
One of my go-to places in downtown SF.
It's a pretty small joint; only seating about 40 people I think, but the food is great, not too expensive and best of all, they're open past midnight!

(A word of caution though - there's typically a 30 minute wait to get in if you go during regular dinner hours and they don't do reservations afaik)

And now a typical night at Cocobang, in rhyme:

Fragrances of fried chicken fill the room,
With k-pop videos playing overhead

By now I've eaten way too much,
Someone please carry me to my bed

Friends cheer as mango soju arrives,
Glasses clink and spirits rise

With bellies full and the bill paid,
We head home with new memories made
author: Sahil S.

description:
Sometimes you just need really good KFC (Korean fried chicken), and Cocobang is the place for that. My ranking of the four flavours: the green onion one, the sweet one, the spicy one, and the regular one (I don't know the exact names, sue me). One person can eat approximately half a chicken portion. 

It comes with Asian coleslaw (aka shredded cabbage and that one Asian dressing all Asian places use for salad), three types of side dishes (bean sprouts, spicy fish cakes, and shredded pickled radish, which tasted a bit funky).

Their other dishes were alright, but not as good as their chicken (hence the four stars) - tried the cheese corn (tastes like you'd expect), seafood pancake (don't think this was worth the money), and kimchi fried rice (average, in my opinion).

I'll definitely come back for the chicken, if the line isn't too long! (Yes, expect a wait, but they do have a waitlist, so make sure to go in and get your name down!)
author: Kevin N.

description:
You know those nights when you crave comfort food but aren't in the mood for pizza or tacos? That's when we hop into the car and drive to Cocobang. Street parking is usually okay and, man, nothing like KFC (Korean fried chicken) to make you feel all warm and fuzzy inside. Here are our usuals:

- cheese corn (or is it corn cheese)!!
- seafood pancake
- kalbi (beef short ribs)
- kimchi fried rice
- spicy tofu soup with rice
- fried chicken - hot & tangy for me!

Some strategery: Order lots and finish everything except the seafood pancake and kimchi fried rice since those reheat well. Sometimes we order those two dishes to go.
author: Lily L.

description:
Not your typical Korean with the many endless sides of kimchi or bean sprouts or pickled cucumber... it was more of a tiny little baby side of four sides.  I came with a group of my girlfriends and I let them choose and they order a lot.  I was afraid it would be way too much but amazingly we finished all.

1. Omelette 2/5
2. Seafood tofu soup 3/5
3. Fried chicken 3/5
4. Marinated pork 3/5
5. Marinated chicken 3/5

Waitstaff were nice and they played top 10 videos on the wall.  Probably wouldn't seek this place out again but nice to have tried it.  Cheers!
author: Nyla K.

description:
**4.5 STARS** My friends and I were at Union Square and surprisingly, there weren't many options for dinner. When we got there around 7:45, the place was packed and i discovered a new feature on yelp for a waitlist. Sadly, we didn't know about it so there were 5 parties ahead of us. The ambiance is pretty cozy, there's booths depending where you sit and also a projector playing music videos. hehe they also played one of my fav songs: selena gomez-back to you.
After a 30 minute wait we were seated at a booth and the server immediately took our orders. So after 10 minutes, our food started coming in. the kalbi korean bbq short ribs are fire YOU MUST ORDER THIS if you ever come! Although the servers were pretty busy, they also refilled our water when it was out.
Overall, it was a great experience EXCEPT for the wait. just remember to enter your name before the waitlist. I'm definitely coming back for the ribs((:
author: Janelle N.

description:
I would highly recommend this place!!! This place is a bit of a hole in the wall, but the food is phenomenal. My boyfriend went there before and recommended it while we were in the area. We went around 7 PM I say the wait was about 40 minutes. They only have about six or seven tables.The one thing that was disappointing was that the host  mentioned that the wait would only be 10 to 15 minutes.

The price is pretty reasonable, we shared a combo dishware we got to choose two items, because the short ribs and bulgogi. I think it was $15.99. The portion was good on the ribs, but they did not give enough Bulgogi in my opinion. We also ordered the fried chicken wings which came with a side of chopped cabbage with heavy spicy mayo sauce on top. I would recommend them to Ding that sauce into more of a ginger citrus sauce instead but the chicken wings were to die for. I believe this was $8.99 and then we ordered kimchi fried rice, it was good not great but in all we really enjoyed the food here and will probably come by again ever in the area.
author: Michelle D.

description:
Ugh my phone died so no pictures!!! 

Yum yum this is the spot to go late night. Open till 4 am. It was only appropriate that when I opened the door a drunk petite woman fell in front of the door and obstructed the entrance for a good 3 minutes while her friends tried to put her up right. I don't think she ever knew where she was because as we were waiting, trying not to stare she then had her head down on the table for the next hour while her friends dined.

I finally got to put my name on the list and it was a short 20 minute wait, only because everything else was so stimulating, drunk people with delicious smells and kpop blasting overhead on the projector... why is 2:30 am the time for Korean food? something about Korean food makes it soak up booze very well. 

I ordered kimchi tofu soup, delicious simple spicy. 
The crispy chicken wings, crunchy and satisfying with a honey glaze. And my boyfriend ordered the seafood ramen which was underwhelming to him but I thought it was pretty good for what it was at 2:30 am. The service was excellent, overly patient (they gotta be patient with their clientele). 

We made friends with some Canadians and had them join us at a 4 top because who knew when these drunk people would be done. Hilarious experience and I would definitely come back just to show others.
author: Megan K.

description:
This place may be good food wise but they told us they are closed at 1:10AM when their closing time is listed as 2AM. 
Change your closing time if you are going to turn down customers 50 min before your closing time.
Very disappointed.
author: Wei D.

description:
I've been DYING to come here for a while but its always packed so I always end up at Halal Guys or some other place open after midnight. But here's the deal, we finally made it one night after midnight off and it definitely did not disappoint.

The kimchi fried rice ($10.95) was pretty darn spicy, which I loved. I think the spicy-ness masked the actual flavor of the kimchi but whatever, it was filling. The seafood pancake ($12.95) was very big and enough for a party of 4. The galbi ($16.95) was also great- juicy, well marinated, etc etc . No complaints there. Service was also friendly and prompt. 

The highlight of my time at Cocobang though was definitely the TWICE and Produce101 MVs playing in the background.

TLDR; Great Korean food to come during/after a heavy night of drinking. I'd give it a 5/5 if it weren't for the SFprices.
author: Yuuki O.

description:
Came here after dining at Coi because we were still hungry... LOL! Ok, we had drinks after Coi then came here, but still. It was around 12:30am when we arrived and it was super packed. Luckily they did a little shifting and opened a table for the four of us. 

Ordered:
x Army Soup - I LOVE budae jjigae while drinking. It's the best chaser EVER! This one was very good, though not cooked for long. 
x Kim Chee Fried Rice - Excellent. 
x Spicy Chicken - We got the extra spicy one, but I didn't think it was THAT spicy. Very good flavors.
x Cheesy Corn - Can never go wrong with cheesy corn and a Korean bar :)

Service was super quick and we got our food super fast. Great place for a late night bite. Decent Korean food in my opinion.
author: Anna M.

description:
Here with a friend for a late night meal on Sunday at 10pm. 

The place was actually fairly busy with only a few tables empty. The selection is fairly limited, we ordered a clam soup, potstickers, and seafood pancake. The clam soup (1 star) just tasted like sugar and MSG, period. I would recommend avoiding it at all cost. The potstickers (3 stars) were not bad and the seafood pancake (2 stars) was dry and skimpy on the seafood. The accompanying flavorful sauce is usually essential to the dish but this restaurant just used sweet soy... This place just feels skimpy on every dish.

No hot tea, service was okay... but be careful gratuity is automatically added to the bill so do not double tip! 

TLDR: I would recommend Zzan for late night eats and Jin Mi for more authentic, generous korean food.
author: Nancy Z.

description:
We ordered the tingy chicken wings. Each order has 6 wings. The 3 of us each grabbed one (but had not bit into them). We realized they gave us the wrong order because we got the regular chicken wings. So we called the waiter over to let him know we have the wrong order. He offered to give us a bowl of sauce to dip. We didn't have a choice because he quickly left. The sauce was cold and that would make our warm wings cold.. So I asked him if we could just get the order we had asked for. He grabbed our plate of 3 chicken wings and returned with the sauce wing order of 3 back.....

We still had not touched the regular wings on our plate so we're like okay..? Now we have half an order or regular and half an order of sauce. 

Anyway, they made it real difficult for us when the fault was their's. This was my first time and they made a pretty bad impression.
author: Sarah T.

description:
Kimchee fried rice is on point, everything else slightly missed the mark for me.  But then again who really knows what they're eating after 3 bottles of soju at 1am.  Which is a point worth mentioning, never eating here sober.  Service is typical.

Food 3
Service 3
Overall 3
author: Patrick C.

description:
Food:  Good, not bad, but it wasn't special either.  We had the kimchi fried rice and were a little disappointed that they used sliced dogs as the protein source.  And we had the korean fried chicken, half sweet sauce and half spicy.  And to our very surprise (and confusion), neither me or my friend could tell the difference.  Both tastes exactly the same.  The only difference was half had sesame seed on top.

Price:  A little pricey.  But it was kinda expected for a korean restaurant in the city.
author: Kev H.

description:
Food: 4/5
Space: 3/5
Service: 4/5

Overall I'm a fan of Cocobang but admittedly there aren't many alternatives for late-night Korean food here in SF. Everything tastes right but I'm not sure if there's anything I've had that would make me come here for a proper dinner-time meal. I'm a fan of the Army Soup and Clam Soup. Service is above-average and friendly, even during busier times. I've only dined-in on a couple of occasions because there's generally a wait later in the evening, so in my opinion take-out is the way to go!
author: Derrick F.

description: I have to say, there are a lot of whiny bitches posting reviews on this website. The food is actually very affordably priced. You people are cheap! I'll say it again, cheap! For San Francisco, this is very affordable and quite tasty food. I have eaten here a lot of times, And invited friends and relatives to eat there, and we always enjoy it. The place is quite clean actually. Unfortunately it's an old building and it's kind of ugly inside, but that does not make it dirty. The waitstaff work really really hard, and provide some of the fastest service I've seen in any restaurant in SF. The food comes Out really quickly, and the servers are always hustling back-and-forth back-and-forth. They are amazing.  It's not a Michelin star restaurant people,get a grip!
author: Sergio B.

description:
Yeah I'm never going here again. Not only are they extremely rude, they call this soft tofu soup. It was left than half filled, it was barely warm, and the egg was still completely raw. 

Especially when there are a couple other Korean restaurants in the area, you'd think they want to be competitive. I'll literally never go here again. I highly recommend you do the same!
author: Jimmy J.

description: When my wife and I travel, we usually like to eat at hole in the wall places.   Cocobang was definitely where the locals go for Korean food! The place is small with limited seating and there was a wait (35-45 min) but the food was awesome and it was served quick.  We tried the Korean wings and it was tasty.  Our entrees were the bbq short ribs, tofu soup, and the corn chowder.  Everything was great and delicious.  I would highly recommend this place if you are visiting SF.
author: Edwin H.

description: The food is good. I like it. Price is decent.  came back here 4 times already when I visit SF. It's a small place
author: Vi T.

description:
We asked the waiter about the vegan options, he said: 1) the Jap Chae is vegan, 2) they can make the bibimbop vegan by substituting the meat with tofu and leaving out the egg. 

I had the jap chae. It was OK, kind of weird because the noodles were kind of gummy. I wouldn't come here again on my own accord. I only came here because my brother and his friends (who are not vegan) like it and it's open late.
author: Sydney W.

description:
OPEN LATE ON A SUNDAY- score!!!

Got the kimchi fried Rice and the combo short ribs and bulgolgi w/ strawberry soju.

Light snack for two and reasonable prices! I'd come back on a Sunday night if I had no choice,but parking is cray- take an Uber
author: Rob V.

description:
Duuuuuude. Coco bang's chicken is perfection. I love how the sauces aren't overbearing. The chicken is so perfectly cooked and most. The outside has a nice crunch. 

We got the green onion chicken and the spicy tangy chicken. The green onions that were served on the side was heaven. The spicy chicken wasn't very spicy :(, but still had a good level of tangy. 

We also got the cheese corn and kimchi pancake. Corn was pretty good, kimchi pancake was a bit dry and didn't have enough kimchi in it.

The yogurt soju was pretty small and overpriced, but it was pretty good (even tho it was a bit weak).

I think I also got takeout from this place a while ago, when I was craving Korean food, since there isn't any decent place to choose from in the depths of soma. I got dumpling rice cake soup and was pretty satisfied.
author: Stephanie K.

description:
I came here with some friends for the first time late on a weekday night and at first glance I was ready for a good time, as the other patrons there all seemed to be happily munching and drinking away. We stood at the entrance for a good 5-7 minutes without anyone acknowledging us so I decided to walk towards the counter to ask for a table. The cashier who was helping another customer ahead of me saw my group and I waiting and still did not acknowledge us even after I came up. After another 5 minutes of waiting this was how the conversation went.

Me: "Hello, I was wonder-"
Him: "How many people"
Me: "Actually I was wondering if you're kitchen was still open?"
Him: "How many people"
Me: "Umm, 4 people"
Him: "Okay" (starts reaching for menus)

At this point I'm thinking I'll try to overlook the rude behavior and just have a good time with my buddies so we go and sit down at the last empty table. The ahjussi then walks back out and tells us he can't serve us because the kitchen is closed as I see everyone else in the restaurant still eating, having a good time, and the staff in the back was still there all cooking. I had enough of the rudeness and total lack of service and happily got up and left. After reading some of the other reviews on here, it's apparent that customer service isn't one of their strong points. Good luck with your business.
author: Viet L.

description: Fried chicken, budae jjigae, soju and beer. Had a great time here and will definitely be back!
author: Michael K.

description:
1) Corn cheese ($7.95) - Typical yet really good. The cheese and the corn mesh well together.

2) Fire Spicy Chicken Rice Cake ($14.95) - Pretty spicy with a good flavor. 

3) Kimchi Pancake ($10.95) - Typical also yet decent. 

4) Yogurt Soju ($12.95) - Yummy and able to split with different people.

The 4 stars is more for the location and for the hours. The food was good and consistent.
author: Wesley K.

description:
Greeted with a stone faced server who looked p*ssed off with us, which is exactly how I expected to be greeted in this kinda of eatery, so plus points already.

A second server came and he was really nice, as a party of two we shared spicy chicken, kimchi tofu stew and half normal fried chicken with two sides of rice.

Totalled around $40 and filled us up! The spicy chicken isn't actually 'asian' spicy. The half normal fried chicken had about 8 pieces and was pretty good! Kimchi tofu stew was SO GOOD.

All in all 4/5, came at a non busy time and had a great experience. The restroom is another story, it's a red room of regret. Hope you don't end up there
author: Terence T.

description:
Love spicy chicken wing，，kimchi jjgea
Everywhere is closed so early in SF.
So here is a one of good places for Korean food in downtown.
author: Yoli X.

description:
We usually come here late after hanging out downtown if we're hungry or want to drink a little more. No matter what time of night, it's always pretty packed. However, they're pretty quick with opening up a spot, even if you're a big group.

Great comfort food that all pair really well with soju:
*soondubu (soft tofu stew) -- good and cheap, but pretty small 
*jap chae (glass noodles) -- pretty unique, a lot more oil than usual
*cheese corn -- soooo good! But gotta eat quickly or else the cheese gets hard 
*soy garlic chicken -- super crunchy and delicious. Comes with a cabbage salad 
*bibimbap -- standard but good 

Definitely a fun, cheap place to go if you're looking to extend your night with some comfort food and soju 

Pro tip: recently changed to CASH only. But a Chase ATM (and a few more) up the block
author: Nicole D.

description: Seriously?? I ordered the food (kimchi fried rice and tofu soup) deliver to my place.... it's the portion of the food! Ridiculous.... will never buy food from them again....
author: Penny L.

description: I had a horrible experience! I called at 2:55am to ask what time they closed. I was told that the kitchen closes at 3:10am, that as long as I made it there before 3:10 they would be able to take my order. I got in an Uber and rushed over there, while in the Uber i also went on yelp and joined the waitlist .... when I got there at 3:06 he told me kitchen was closed ... I don't understand why you would make me waste my time money and energy. It's rude, horrible customer service. You told me 3:10. Not to mention I was on the waitlist as well for 3:09 .
author: Ariel K.

description:
This is the favorite place to hangout at midnight!! Right after you're done clubbing and hungry, or you're working too hard and remember to eat at late night, cocobang is here!!! 


They have really nice soju cocktails which goes really well with their awesome corncheese. 
Also, they have delicious japchae, hot stone bibimbap. 
The staff are very friendly.
Just a heads up...you need to wait in line for a while 
Also, Big Party---all people need to be on spot to be seated!
author: Kusum T.

description: Our hotel was right around the corner, so we found this place through Yelp. Corn cheese, rolled egg omelet / omurice, army soup and Korean fried chicken? Can't go wrong with that! Everything we had this day was good! Perfect beer and soju late-night drinking food.
author: Sherry V.

description: Everything was so delicious I had the sweet sauce marinated chicken! There soups came out hot and fresh tofu with seafood, just make sure you tell them a little spice! The atmosphere was cool, great music on a screen to see the videos!! Love it!!!
author: Cindy L.

description:
Let's just say DANG! This place is definitely a BANG, the food is so delicious! Great service as well! Of course there are way better Korean places, but for San Francisco they are definitely on the top few Korean places to go eat! Also a heads up to party of 6 of more be ready to wait if you go after 6pm since it's a small restaurant and it starts to get packed.

We got the sweet & spicy Korean chicken wings, kimchi fried rice, spicy short ribs and corn cheese. 

Corn cheese: $7.95
I'm speechless because of how good all of the food was. I was surprise that such a simple dish as corn and cheese together could be so delicious. 

Kimchi fried rice: $10.95
The kimchi fried rice was so good, I think it might be the best I have so far in my life to be honest.

Sweet& spicy chicken wings: $7.95
The sweet & spicy chicken wings were made perfectly. The flavors were delicious and so crunchy, the lettuce on the side helps the spiciness even out.

Spicy beef short ribs BBQ: $16.95
Last but not least the spicy short ribs. OMG it was so spicy but so good, that the pain was so satisfying. 

Definitely a spot to come back again! And the fact that it's a block away from ruby skye and bars makes it a great midnight drunk munchies place.
author: Christopher G.

description:
I live about a block and a half from here and sometimes when I'm in the mood for Korean Fried Chicken I'll come here and order takeout. The issue is that the chicken just isn't that good. I really liked the chicken at OB Town in Berkeley but this chicken is much more dry and the sauce is not as well made.

This is mainly a review of the takeout/delivery experience. I will update if I go in and sit down, and will try the Galbi, which it seems like people consistently enjoy.
author: Henry Z.

description: Road trip all the way down to SF from Seattle, was looking for something to eat at 11:30pm when I arrived. The food is surprisingly delicious. (I ordered seafood pancake, omelette and chicken salad)
author: Kevin Y.

description: I would give this 3.5 stars instead of 4 if I could. The food was quite good - we got the spicy rice cakes with ramen and the sweet fried chicken. Service was ok. However, we were seated with a man who kept talking to us and made us really uncomfortable. This wasn't really the restaurants fault but because this is a place that's open pretty late, there will be a lot of sketchy/drunk people around (even on weekdays). Also, make sure to come early/late to avoid the line.
author: Rachelle H.

description: My friends know that on a typical wknd night i am probably drunk af and eating KFC (korean fried chicken) at 2am. Thank you cocobang for really making my night outs. Who needs a bf when you got twice fried hot wings.
author: Bora Y.

description:
If you're expecting good service and respect, you should go elsewhere. This is likely the worst customer service I've had in years, and I'm disappointed to say that I've experienced in one of my favorite cities in the world. While the food safety rating of 69 should already be a deterrent, our group was hungry at 2:30am and wanted to get some late night eats. However, what happened next should be a cautionary tale for anyone seeking late night dining (go to Halal Guys if you're in the area!)--if you're not Korean, you will get seated by the restaurant to wait outside (yes, even if you're a girl and shivering!) and be served after their preferred groups have been seated first.

My words of advice to this establishment: if you post "First Come First Served", please honor this--else "First Come, Served Last (After Preferred Groups)" would be more appropriate. Plus, a rating of 69 food safety is a bit hazardous, even for folks who have some alcohol left in their bellys to disinfect your food.
author: Nancy W.

description:
Posted hours are incorrect. Cocobang closes whenever they want and will turn away customers as early as 1:00 am.
For a restaurant whose biggest selling point is their late-night hours, this is a pretty big negative. Cross your fingers and hope you don't get turned away!
author: Donny G.

description: 3/5 for food + extra star for being open late. What's with SF not having a lot of restaurants with kitchen that are open late night ?? Food is mediocre at best but to get your fix, this place does the job.
author: Jelly J.

description:
Love love love. First and foremost I love eating and I am willing to try anything. Korean is my #1 all time fave! I grew up in a family that loves spicy food. My mom is from Singapore and their curry is amazing. I ordered the hot and tangy half fried chicken which was delicious along with the side of salad, great combination. My daughter and I shared the seafood pancake. Another winner in my book. For my personal entree, a meal in itself, I ordered the tteokbokki, I have been waiting to try it for so long.
As soon as I spooned it in my mouth, the rush of the spiciness in my mouth was heart pounding. It was so good that my ears whistled. Fresh and fast service. Going to go for the gizzards next time! Going back again indefinitely.
author: Tina L.

description: A hole in the wall spot for Korean food.  Literally a hole in the wall, small and cozy, but it honestly gave me the a germophobe feeling due to how unclean everything felt.  Seats about 10-15 people.  Came here with some co-workers after work.  Food was great but had better at other Korean spots.
author: jason v.

description:
Went to Cocobang with a few friends this last weekend, and one member of the group knew all the good things to order because it's his favorite place in the city. So, based on his recommendations being absolutely amazing, I'll recommend them to all of you! 

- Corn Cheese - this is exactly what it sounds like, a bunch of corn covered in cheese and melted on a hot griddle. Super simple, but super delicious! And lots of good burnt cheese to munch on. 
- Pan Fried Clear Noodle w/ Vegetable - simple.. clear noodles and veggies, but absolutely yummy! 
- Fried Chicken w/ Hot & Tangy Sauce - super yummy fried chicken.. I definitely wouldn't consider it to be hot, so don't be thrown off by that if you don't like spicy. Be careful when biting in, because some of the wings have bones and some don't. 
- Kimchi Pancake - one big pancake served with a delicious dipping sauce. It's more bread-like than an actual pancake. I'd recommend it as an appetizer to share with the table. 
-OB Pitcher - just what it sounds like! A pitcher of cold beer to wash everything down with. 

They're also open late night, so we went after a concert for a super late dinner and it was perfection. 

Minus one star for the poor food safety score.. I am kind of glad I didn't see that prior to eating there because it would've scared me! But since I had such a great experience, I'm inclined to want to go back sometime regardless.
author: Traci A.

description: Food was really good, however, customer service is GODDAMN BADDDDDDDD. This old man serving us was so rude and unsatisfied about the tips. And if service is bad, you don't even deserve any tip lol. There weren't really many customers there at all at the time we were there but the music was loud ASF. It went from ratchet American music to sad music that I couldn't even hear what my friend was saying. And harassing your customers in front of others isn't so professional, definitely won't be coming back! If you want to go try some nice korean food, I suggest Zzan (right across from this restaurant), Aria(!!!), etc.
author: Sofia B.

description:
I really like Cocobang! First of all, it's close to my apartment. But most of all, they have a nice wide selection of Korean food and a decent selection of Korean drinks (a couple of beer choices and soju cocktails).

The cheese corn is really good, as are the potstickers. I've also recently started really enjoying the beef tofu soup - I ordered this as a pickup order and it didn't disappoint. It's also highly recommended to order the fried chicken (my favourite is the one which comes with green onion).

It can be quite loud inside as they're open late and cater to people who want to primarily drink, primarily eat, or do both. So you might find yourself seated next to a rowdy table or a quiet couple depending on your luck. But overall it's a good time.
author: Joe B.

description:
Just a tiny hole in the wall around the corner from Commonwealth Club; perfect place to kick back afterwards. Wednesday night, party of five, told it was a twenty minute wait.

Fried chicken 8.95 (half chicken) | All reviews said to get the original chicken. Wrong. Get the "hot" and tangy, which is more sweet and no heat. Still delicious and crunchy.

Corn Cheese 7.95 | Sizzling hot plate of corn and cheese. That's it. Kind of like a Korean version of esquites. Perfect drunk/fat girl bar food. Sweet and cheesy. Really, it should be the official state dish of Nebraska.

Too many other dishes to even write about, but none of them disappointed. Affordable prices, generous portions, patient staff. I'd definitely come here again.

Beer. Basement bathrooms downstairs. Next door to expensive parking garage // street parking is a bitch. Semi-comfortable for gordas.
author: Illyanna M.

description: My friend and I came to Cocobang after a concert two blocks away, and their waiting list was done digitally through Yelp, which we found interesting. The place is a little cramped, but the food smelled and tasted good. We ordered the kimchi fried rice, the spicy tofu soup, and the bossam. The service was pretty quick, and everything came out extremely hot! The tofu soup was perfect for a cold day, and the egg on the kimchi fried rice really made it a solid comfort food. The bossam was very authentic and the sauces they provided added some extra flavor.
author: Heather Z.

description:
Cocobang was a BUST!!!!!

How can they charge customers $7.95 for literally TWO bites of clear noodles?! I can buy 3 packs of clear noodles and cook that shit myself. 

We opened the container and was in disbelief. It was a joke, the amount of noodles in the take out box barely cleared a quarter of the box. I pick up a chopstick full and it was already half the portion. My husband packaged the meal back up (luckily we live close) and went back to the restaurant. They told him the portions were smaller because it was an appetizer. What the fuck? So we could eat 5 noodles each?! We have been loyal customers and have ordered the same dish many times before....with NORMAL sized portions. 

Their kimchi fried rice was okay. Filled with slivered sausage for meat and the fried egg was popped and over cooked.

A shame, as their KFC was delicious, as always. But with this service and lack of portion control, it's doubtful we'll ever go back. You'd think with 707 and Zzan right around the corner they'd step up their game.
author: Michelle C.

description: My first visit to Cocobang was a solid one! Cute ambience and a big plus to me is they're open late! You could also combine two BBQ items for $16; I ordered the chicken bulgogi and Spicy BBQ short ribs to go along my side of kimchi fried rice, all for $31. The only beef I have (no pun intended) with Cocobang was the chicken bulgogi was slathered in grease and the chef was quite overhanded with the bell peppers, which gave off this peppery flavor in the bulgogi, instead of the sweet bbq flavor I was expecting.  It's all good, plenty of room for improvement...and oh, make sure you get an Uber here, parking is sparse in the city!
author: Chris A.

description: Check in on yelp and cut the line for some amazing chicken and creamy cheesy deliciously surprising corn, that arrives still sizzling in its own little skillet. The spices on the various fried chicken are to die for, and the accompanying slaw adds a nice balance to a hearty meal. Try the grapefruit Soju for a refreshing addition to any spicy meal.
author: Sarah R.

description: Really small restaurant, but surprisingly good. Their kimchi fried rice with egg was perfectly moist. We also got their spicy tofu soup, which was so great on a chilly night in the city. Their chicken is known to be really good as well, but we got the sweeter sauce which was probably a mistake (it was only decent). I didn't get to try anything else, but I'd love to come back and try their bulgogi and galbi dishes. They're open pretty late too, which is nice if you're in the area and want to grab real food after bar-hopping. It's a bit pricier for Korean food than normal, but it's also very close to Union Square so not too surprising.
author: Victoria L.

description:
Small k-place, but it gets the Korean food fix in!

If all parties are not here, they can't seat you.  Didn't know that and dinner time, fills up fast!  My plus one wasn't here so we didn't get seated until later when tables were packed and I got the glare from the waiters and the party of two that had to wait after me.  I insisted that I can order and was made uncomfortable during the dining experience. Besides that point, food was spot on.

I ordered up Combo C - clam soup, soju drink, seafood pancake and spicy octopus!

I added the chicken with cheese on sizzling platter because I was ogling at all the deliciousness on the menu items and felt like that was needed for order and did so accordingly!

I liked the spicy octopus the most. Clam soup could have been better on the broth.  Seafood pancake was made well.  The chicken with cheese was yum only if it eaten sizzling hot! 

The perk about this place is that it opens late till 4am!  Oh, you know the convenience is always great when it comes to late night eateries!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Don't get me wrong, this was GOOD! But they missed the mark with a couple things.

They got my pickup order slightly incorrect. Not a big deal. They fixed it right away. 

The restaurant itself is so much smaller than I realized. But it looks like maybe there were two levels? 

Minor complaint with the corn cheese was that I felt like it could have been a little cheesier. It was already very cheesy but they could push the envelope here to really make it exceptional. 

The fried chicken with hot & tangy sauce was tasty, but not crispy enough. It tasted like it had been crispy at one point but it had already turned mushy by the time I ate it. If it's fried chicken, it should be crispy. 

Relatively "wallet" friendly for a dinner in San Francisco. 

Haven't made up my mind but I might come back to try the fried chicken again. Recommend you try this place for yourself.
author: Christopher J.

description: Some coworkers and I went here after a night of club/bar drinking and ate almost everything we ordered. The ususal: Kimchi fried rice, sweet corn and cheese, kimchi, korean bbq (forgot which one since i was to hammered) coulve been bulgogi, and other things. They were all delicious and especially the corn and cheese! Its a small little spot so the wait could be more than you expected since it gets packed after club hours but the wait was worth it. They have text alerts when your table is ready.
author: Bryan R.

description: craving for KFC(Korean fried chicken) on a Friday night, definitely go with order take out. Had half fried chicken and a seafood pancake, they are so good!! Also love their radish!!
author: Xinya Z.

description: Reasonalble price and the atmosphere made me feel like i was in Korean. I tried seafood pacheon and a kimchi tofu soup. I really like the soup but the pachon it just ok. Compared with Dae Jung GumTofu House, i thinki do like the one from DJGTH more!!!
author: Tiratiwan L.

description: My favorite Korean spot in SF! You must get the burning fire chicken with rice cakes.
author: Natasha H.

description: the last time i came here i was too messed and forgot if i enjoyed the food or not but after eating here again, i realized i did enjoy the food! my friends and i always wanna get the army stew and it was soooo good. it was a little spicy for me since i can't handle a lotta heat but i enjoyed it!
author: diane d.

description:
I've been meaning to find a good korean food/bar place in SF. I've seen this place a lot so I tried to go once on a saturday night, and found the wait way too long because the seating is pretty limited.

So, on a weekday for dinner, I ordered some hot and tangy fried chicken through Eat24. The estimated time on Eat24 was 45-60 minutes (are you srs) so I called to ask for a better estimate, and they said around 15 minutes! yay! the food arrived in 20-25 minutes, which is pretty good. 

DELIVERY: The chicken and side salad, which both had liquidy sauces were in a clear plastic container. And the sauce was all. over. everything. in the plastic bag. Unfortunate. But not surprised because this plastic container was definitely not meant to hold liquid. Also, fried chicken with vegetable right next to it for takeout? no bueno. vegetable gets warm and weird, and the chicken gets super mushy. I ordered the food only about a 5 minute drive away from cocobang and it had cooled down immediately.

NOW FOR THE ACTUAL FOOD: besides two wings, the chicken pieces were nearly the size of my fist. that means wayy too little sauce for each huge chunk of chicken. Also, the water from the salad had washed off some of the sauces of some of the chicken pieces. The taste of the sauce itself was fine, though it was just sweet and sour rather than hot at all. Also, the pickled radish that comes with the chicken side was definitely not ready. It had not been pickled long enough because besides the vinegary sauce that you taste on the surface of the radish, there was no taste inside. 

$16 for a whole chicken, $3 delivery, and $2 tax.
707 has better chicken.
author: Grace P.

description:
This is hands down the best late night food place around town. They open until 2am mostly of the days and until 4am on weekends. Though if you come on a weekend past midnight, you will probably encounter drunk and loud people, so be aware.

The wait here is generally around 30 minutes. If you are a 2-person group, you might get better luck with this. But no matter how long you have to wait, this place is worth it. I always get the Army Soup here. It's delicious and especially comforting on a cold windy day. My friends love their Fire Spicy Chicken w/ Cheese. We also enjoy their Strawberry Soju a lot.

They are available to host private parties, so if you have a big crowd and want to enjoy good food for special occasions, look no further ;)
author: Angel C.

description: favorite late night spot! the five spice chicken is amazing, and i love the yogurt soju. can't thank them enough for being open late enough for me and my boyfriend after work!
author: Danelle S.

description:
Cocobang just really hit the spot for me. After spending the afternoon at various bars, we came here at the recommendation of one of my friends. We got here around 9pm, and as expected the place was packed. The place itself is a bit of a hole in the wall, with K-pop playing in the background. After getting in and putting our name in, it was a 30 minute wait. However, it was well worth the wait. Also since we were starving, we actually put in our order before we sat, so that as soon as we were seated the food and drinks came out. 

We got the corn cheese, regular fried chicken, Pork Spicy Tofu Soup (Soon Du Bu Jjigae), and the Boiled pork with Spicy Daikon, and a peach soju. The corn cheese, is basically what it sounds like, corn and cheese on a hot skillet, was a nice appetizer. The fried chicken was juicy, but a little bland. The tofu soup was delicious however, and the real star was the boiled pork. Taking the daikon, you basically construct a little wrap in what ends up being mouthfuls of flavor. Overall, the food and soju were very satisfying, and had a great value.
author: Leon K.

description:
Came here for late night drunchies on a Saturday evening. Small location so we did have to wait for a table for our party of four (15 min~). 

Shares the large army soup and fried chicken for the table. The soup seemed endless and is the perfect warm dish to order after going out. It's loaded with a lot of toppings and ramen to fill you up. The fried chicken we ordered was surprisingly tasty too. The meat was tender and the two sauces we ordered were quite flavor, granted I could barely differentiate the flavors. 

The ban chan was meh. I've had better and the selection was slim. But the food made up for it. 

I was pretty stuffed after this meal. With a pitcher of beer split amongst us, it ended up costing ~$18 per person. Good meal and would come back for late night food
author: Carissa G.

description:
Sigh is all I really have to say.
Sometimes I'd come here after bar hopping in the Union Square area, but honestly I am not coming back. Compared to Korean food in LA, this place hardly matches up. It's rather run down and in a summary slightly janky Korean junk food. What really hit the nail in the coffin for me, is when I had gone recently and it had taken approximately 40 minutes for my food to come. I paid a small tip, and the owner stopped me and said are you really going to pay such a low tip? to my friend's face.

Look, I could've just not come in the first place, your food isn't amazing and being so condescending towards customers is definitely not the way to go! 

I will definitely not be continually supporting this business.
author: Goldie C.

description:
Came in on a late night whim, so happy. The food was very yummy and was came out pretty fast.....only 4ish complementary side dishs (_)
They play kpop on the wall, super cool!!!! Ill stop by when Im in the area (*^_^*)
author: Angelica A.

description:
It said its first come first serve and they do not take the reservation, which is totally ok.

But the waiter asked us are we Beth or someone else. Apparently they took the reservation.
So what's going on? They do the secret reservation now? And there is a couple came before us but they won't let them in. Weird. 
Food was ok-ish.
author: Erica L.

description:
[Updated from October 2014. Combining an old Yelp account into this one.]

Was visiting and staying nearby. Walked by a couple of nights late and saw the place was packed all the time, so decided to go there one night for dinner. Nothing fancy from the ambiance side, but the host was awesome, got 4 of us in within minutes and helped us with some of the food recommendations as everything was Korean pub / street fare and not something I have a deep knowledge in. I have to say I loved just about every morsel, some more than others, price was very reasonable, service prompt and I'd definitely would come back. If you're looking for a night time, avoiding a hangover, type of adventure of spicy, salty, sweet and savory food, it hits the spot.
author: Mario K.

description: I have a delivery order of a chicken wing and a seafood tofu soup, but I'm a little disappointed that the soup only fill up half of the bowl.
author: Zhuo L.

description: Ordered $120 worth of take out from Cocobang and they gave us less than half a box for each order of kimchi fried rice...are you serious? Pretty furious about this.
author: Roger P.

description: One of my favorite spots in San Francisco. I really enjoy the food and soju. My favorite dish would have to be the Fire Spicy Chicken with Cheese, you should all try it.
author: Joseph B.

description:
Hats off to this place for being open til 4am. For a late night place, it doesn't get much better than this!

I recommend the:
- kimchi fried rice
- kimchi pancake
- spicy sticky rice cake (duk bok gi)
- bulgolgi 

The food isn't out of this world but for what you pay (~$10/dish) and how late they're open it's great. 

As for the people complaining about the service - the waiters are nice. And consistently I've seen the same guys work there weekend after weekend. If you had to work until 4am on a weeknight, how would you be? They may not be rainbows and roses but they're nice to customers. 

Tip: come before 2:30 otherwise you'll probably end up waiting an hour.
author: Lucy W.

description: I used to go to this restaurant when I studied in SF a few years back, and I thought it was one of good Korean style fried chicken place. So, I visited here again, but it was really disappointing. The half&half friend chicken was not that good. It was too crispy outside, and not soft inside.  Also, it is cash only place. So, please be aware of this!!!
author: Mason S.

description: Really yummy and affordable dinner. Loud music and good service. Recommend the cheesy corn and short ribs!
author: Alex N.

description:
Good korean food! 
A little skimpy on the ponchin(sp?) (The little side dishes served at all Korean places).
The atmosphere is nothing fancy by any means but the food is well priced and decently portioned.
Good eats overall, lost stars for dirty bathrooms, ancient dirty menus, and servers who arent very interested in checking in with you.
author: T S.

description:
**3.5 stars, rounded up**

There's not a lot of restaurants that are open past 11pm on week days near the Mission, trying to find a late night Korean restaurant is even harder.

Don't fret, my fellow soju lovers - Cocobang opens til late, really late!
Sun-Thurs from 5:30pm to 2am, Fri- Sat from 5:30pm to 4am. Daebak!! 

Cocobang's kitchen is a one-woman show. This cute ahjummonie is badass. Regardless of how packed they are with drunken patrons, the food still comes out fast and hot. 
I've been here 3 times so far, and have never waited longer than 10-15 mins each time. 
Or maybe I just didn't notice the wait because there's always cute korean kpop-like waiters running around, lol..

Banchan flavors are spot on and plentiful. The kimchi has just the right amount of sourness and spice to it. http://bit.ly/1LhqTTO

I can't tell you anything about their mixed soju drinks ($12.95), since we only drink Chamisul Soju ($10.95) straight out the bottle. None of that frufru shet.

The full menu is extensive. They even have dried file fish and cuttlefish as anju (Korean equivalent to the all-American beer nuts).

Warning: Pics may be a bit blurry due to excessive soju drinking. Chee hoo! 

FRIED CHICKEN ($9 for 1/1; $15-$17 for whole bird):
1) Regular/KFC: Thin crust with a distinctive crunch thanks to a coating of corn starch. This was our favorite.
2) Hot & Tangy/Yangnyeom: Tossed in a sweet vinegary spicy gochujang sauce.
3) Garlic Sweet Sauce
4) Green Onion/Padak: Glazed in a sweet soy mustard sauce and covered in a mound of spring onions. 

We got the combination of the regular fried chicken and the spicy yangnyeom one. 
http://bit.ly/1STa4Fh
The regular KFC was a clear winner of the two. The sauced up chicken was too soggy and the sauce itself just tasted overly sweet.

GALBI ($15.95): 
http://bit.ly/1MQQjc2
The marinated beef short ribs were tender and flavorful. 
- Price was a bit stiff for just just 2 pieces (which they cut up to make 6 pieces).

Kimchi Fried Rice ($10.95): 
http://bit.ly/1PK3ErR
I wasn't a fan of this, as it was too sweet for my taste. I couldn't taste the kimchi, too much sweet gochujang and ketchup. The slices of hot dog in it was also flavorless and overpowered by the sauce. 

FRIED MANDOO ($7.95 for 6 pc):  
http://bit.ly/1MwKxgD
There's a good amount of pork in their small mandoo, with just the right amount of glass noodles and tofu. Clean flavors and tasty. But hella pricey for $8....

KIMCHI JEON ($11.95): 
http://bit.ly/1H45eDU
This pancake was thick and filling. Was a bit worried when it arrived looking like thick pita bread, but surprisingly it tasted pretty good. You get a mouthful of ripe kimchi in every bite.

CHICKEN CUTLET ($12.95):
http://bit.ly/1ONdniK
I wasn't impressed with their version of chicken katsu. It was thin and a bit dry. Their sweet "special sauce" tasted like it was ketchup-based. 

SPICY TOFU SOUP ($10.95):
http://bit.ly/1MQQuEo
Choice of protein- Seafood, beef, pork, kimchi or vegetable.
Choice of level of spiciness- Mild, medium, spicy or extra spicy.
- This bubbling earthenware of goodness hits the spot after a long night of partying. 
The broth could use more depth in flavor, perhaps more kelp and dried anchovies when boiling the broth? But the silken tofu just melts in your mouth. My tummy (and poor liver) were quite happy.

SPICY PORK ($12.95):
http://bit.ly/1QGi6C3
It's a nice change to find thinly sliced pork butt/shoulder being used instead of the thicker pork belly. What you end up with is just tender bites of lean porky goodness.

BEEF BULGOGI ($14.95):
http://bit.ly/1Nz6w6q
Grilled marinated sliced beef. Simple, delicious and goes well with just a hot bowl of rice. 
- You can combine any 2 sizzling bbq for $16.95. We decided to also get the SPICY PORK & BEEF BULGOGI combo.

Overall, just a good late night place to get your Korean food fix .The food is good and the service is excellent.
author: Cin T.

description: Actually I had a great pleasure and tasty food here. Thanks for great time and nice evening, Cocobang!
author: Zaire T.

description:
There are ups and downs to this place. I tried it since we were in the area. It's quite small and there's a few booths on one side and a row of tables on the other side. You're very, very close to each other and the tables are side by side. Honestly, that doesn't bother me. I like little local places, but the things that didn't resonate with me well is their health score!!! I didn't notice the score until after we ate, but it's posted on the wall and I also see it here on Yelp. It's definitely below average, and even not passing. I think it's important to keep up with health regulations--for the safety of your customers. 

The service was quick and the food was mediocre.
author: Karen P.

description: Went up to the register to put my name down and evidently I don't look Korean to them because I was warmly welcomed with a racial Chinese slur which the tall scumbag with longer hair muttered to his coworker in Korean. If you don't want to be disrespected because you're not Korean like them or you are Korean but not inclined to act high and mighty due to your ethnicity, take your business elsewhere. That's what I did. What trash.
author: Candace L.

description: The food is good and reasonably priced. However, the place is just dirty. The floor doesn't look as if it's been cleaned in a while. Don't expect ambiance.
author: William B.

description: The place is cool and the service was great but the food was not that great... got fried chicken with sweet and spicy sauce and they came out cold and the sauce was just not good.
author: Michael C.

description:
Ordered combo, bulgogi and galbi
So tender, juicy, delicious and good price.
U definitely will go again
author: Hae-Young K.

description: This is a hole in the wall place. Yes beware of the wait but the servers get your food out fast after you order it. You forget how Hangry you were and dig I'm! Best Korea in downtown for sure!
author: Gardenia H.

description: the line was soooo long at like 9pm!! i will need to go back to check it out again since i only went once like 5-6 years ago.
author: Yeonhwa S.

description:
Got here around 10pm on a friday night for a late dinner. Luckily I guess since we're between the dinner and the clubbing crowds, there was no wait! We got some yogurt soju, beef short ribs, burning fire spicy chicken and corn cheese.

Their banchan is kind of sparse - just three very small plates of pickled daikon, fishcakes, and bean sprouts. I had none of the chicken since I can't tolerate spicy food at ALL, but my boyfriend really liked it and said it was really flavorful (but not THAT spicy haha). The short ribs were good but towards the end got way too greasy/oily for me. All in all, I think the food was pretty good, but for how much you get, WAY too expensive tbh. It's a nice option though if you're looking for a filling meal late at night.
author: Stephany L.

description:
Very good, spicy soondubu (spicy tofu soup). 

The cleanliness score is 90!!!! The sign is posted right at the entrance. Please check them out.
author: Nas M.

description: Wow, so yummy! had the spicy kimchi pork tofu dish and a beef and chicken dish. Both were absolutely yummy! Man I cant believe how big the beers were. Cute place with a Big Screen TV showing Fun videos. Theyre open til 2am!!!! Im def coming back here. The food was the right kind of salty not too much and not too little. Perfectly seasoned. Gonna bring my wifey here.
author: Attic F.

description:
Great Korean fried chicken for it's price.

I wish they had family or combo meals like fried chicken with teukbokki or something. That would be awesome - two of my favorites.
author: Char C.

description: They charge higher for the tips, even I am not noticed because they extra charge people's money fee. When there is seats' available, they only let us sit in the small table and small space.
author: Yijing W.

description:
Came here twice, once to dine in and once for pick up. Both times I got the fried chicken, which is serviceable but almost all the other fried chickens I've tried were better. But pretty good portion sizes for the price so you're getting a good amount of food for what you're paying. The first time I got the deukbeokki with ramen. The ramen noodles were too soggy, would not recommend them. The second time I got a kimchi pancake and part of it was burnt. The parts that weren't burnt tasted okay though.

Good location if you have late night muniches, but wouldn't come here for dinner again.

Edit: Came here again and was met with the most awful customer service. The waiters were extremely rude and condescending.
author: Cassie Z.

description: Great find!!!!  Looks like a hole in the wall but this is the place to be!  Korean food never tasted so good.  Lots of locals and a young crowd.  Get there early because space is limited.
author: Nina E.

description: You know this place is legit when it has a low health score haha. I always get the rice cakes and corn cheese. SOOOO GOOD! Only lame thing is their bibimbap doesn't come in a stone bowl so the rice doesn't crisp on the bottom. Laaaame..
author: Angela L.

description: This is my favorite restaurant and I always have dinner with my friends. Usually, when I came first any servers getting me to the table immediately when there was available table. But today there is some terrible guy who has a long hair and put on the glasses, tell me that your friends have to come completely. I'm just confused that it doesn't make sense why I can't get the table ? cuz I told him I was ready to order. Just in case, if I go for myself he won't seat me. His co-worker was perfect but that guy was terrible.
author: Aooair A.

description:
This place is pretty tiny so expect a wait if you're coming during normal eating hours! We got there right when it opened so there was no wait, but make sure your whole party is with you or they won't seat you.

To be honest the food here isn't that good but the soju drinks are pretty cheap so I can see myself coming back. For food we ordered all the different flavors of fried chicken, and it was just that, fried chicken dipped in different sauces.
