as soon as i walked in i decided it was a little too fancy inside to be good korean food.  however, i did notice that most of the patrons were korean and the air had the smokiness that i associate with yummy bi bim bop.  and of course there was a hanging projector screen playing korean music videos- fun!

however, i'd probably say my favorite thing that night was introducing my friends to the OB beer and the yogurt soju.  since they don't date an asian guy like i do they've never had flavored soju in the standard little pitcher or seen a 1.6 liter bottle of OB.  at the end of dinner they were grabbing across the table for my unfinished soju and beer.  haha.

we ordered the fire chicken, which was really lacking in the chicken department, but i was happy to see all the noodle rolls.  they should probably change the name of the dish to "fire noodle" since that's mostly what you're eating.  

we got potstickers too, (which should have been the most delicious drunk food ever since we had been to about 4 bars before we came in) but they were just dry and blah.  went down fine into the tummy, but not exciting at all. 

the bi bim bap was great-tasting and fresh, and i could tell my friend Erin S. was pleased by it b/c she got to work mixing it up right away.  there was a good assortment of veggies and i especially liked the mushrooms and i noted that the egg on top was cooked enough to not be runny.

i'll come back b/c i love  any place that has OB and yogurt soju (they had lots of flavors too and it wasn't weak at all) and it's close to the powell BART stop.  next time i'll drink drink drink and order less food.  i think this place has great potential for being a new friday happy hour meet-up for me.
author: Holly B.

description: things i love: eating late night hot spicy food and nice people. at cocobang you get both! although they say the food is really spicy, if youre a spice lover like myself you wont think it is that spicy. but it does hit the spot esp when you are hungry and a little buzzed. the service is great, there was a wait at 12:30 so i gave them my number and we walked around. it worked out perfectly. the guy running the show is super nice and patient with us as we were first timers. def get the chicken wings -- very tasty, perfectly fried, boneless, and drenched in sauce! the bi bim bap does not come in a cast iron pot though so you will have to go without the crispy burnt rice at the bottom, but otherwise it was tasty enough. LOVE the k-pop videos. i couldn't keep turning around and staring at the screen in between hurried bites of chicken.
author: Cathy L.

description:
This is a late night gem!!  When everything else is closing up, Coco's keeps it going, serving beer, soju and sake until 4AM!!

The late night crowds are always fun.
author: Travis E.

description:
If you think you can handle REALLY spicy, this is the place to go! Order a plate of super spicy fire chicken and if you can finish it, you can count yourself crowned "champion spice eater"! If you are a normal person with an affinity for spicy food, then order the regular spicy chicken and a plate of (pork) bulgogi and a LOT of beer or flavored soju! Trust me, without the beer or soju you are not going to last beyond a few bites! 

They were out of the flavored sojus we wanted to try, so we went with a few mugs of beer (light and not too cold - it was a perfect match for the food) and people watched as the hip young Korean crowd frolicked inside and outside the restaurant. The meat was of decent quality (if a bit fatty, but not too bad), the service was excellent, and the tab was ~ $30 (before tip) for 2 - I would definitely go back next time I'm in the 'hood and have a 1:30 a.m. hankering for good bar food washed down with plenty of soju and beer and Korean pop music.
author: rupa b.

description:
this hole in the wall place serves an awesome authentic korean food. all my k friends approved! they open late and the price is right.

recommended dishes:
kimchi noodle soup
kimchi pancake
kimchi fried rice
kimchi everything lol
oh and dukboki is pretty good too
author: oranuj k.

description:
i like the fact that this place is relatively easy to get to (especially for korean restaurants) and open late. the spicy chicken wings are pretty fire, and overall the food is pretty tasty. i think there are better places to go for the price, but given the location i think it's worth it here. 

both times i've gone it's been pretty empty, even on friday nights. can't decide whether that's good or bad. nice to find a seat, but slightly awkward when there are only a few tables taken up. but i guess i'll take that over the 2+ hour wait at toyose most weekends.
author: Monica C.

description:
after reading decent reviews written by several yelpers, i decided to check out this place last weekend. it was located one block away from redwood room and ruby skye (you get the idea where it's at). because of the location, finding a parking space may become a problem for most peop although i luckily found a spot on the street. 

this place is definitely not a restaurant. it's a little k-drinking joint.  it almost feels like a rundown cafe in college town with a brick-wall and a high ceiling and all, except that there are soju bottles on each table instead of caramel mochiatos. i simply didn't like the ambiance. 

with a couple of soju shots in my system, i tried their signature dish cheese bool-dock (fiery chicken). i'd had bool-dock before in los angeles k-town, but dude, it wasn't it. it was not even spicy (little exaggerated). we felt like we just got raped. give us a Tabasco sauce, i asked. 

after one hour, we left the place.
author: Bennet A.

description: The server is very RUDE. I was standing at the counter waiting to place a to-go order, and the server coming out from the kitchen just PUSHED to the side to make way. I have never had some terrible experience with the service. It is not acceptable, and i will never go back to this place again.
author: Kate J.

description:
The food was decent from what i remember. The wings were horrendous! it was covered in this weird tasting spicy red gunk... i had to scrape it off for it to be semi edible... ugh....kinda gross tasting actually... 
we ordered kalbi and when it came out, it tasted like bul gol gi... um...
and dont even get me started on the soju that everyone seems to be raving about... our server brought out a pitcher and it was filled to the brim with CRUSHED ICE. and the soju was soooo watered down already. i was pretty darn pissed. i lived in south korea for a month and i had never had crushed ice in my falvored soju. am i missing something here? is this common practice? i am honestly confused... did the server give that to us thinking we wouldnt know any better since we didnt order in korean? the same thing with the kalbi; did he think we wouldnt know the difference? im so annoyed jsut thinking about it right now! and the soju was expensive!! we were thinking about treating ourselves to some soju even though we were on a budget, and we got watered down semi-flavored ice soju! GAR. never again will i order soju from this joint. 
don't think i'll be back, unless im pretty desperate.
author: Diana T.

description: I visited this place by myself. It was a lonely time. I looked at my face in the reflection of my menu and began to sob. I ordered the chicken cutlets with korean sauce. Apparently korean sauce = ketchup. The chicken was not salty enough so I cried on it. Still though, I would only give this place 5 stars after stumbling upon it in a post-apocalyptic scenario.
author: Morgan C.

description: Great if you are in the mood for some trashy Korean food. You might regret it the next day but it goes down great.
author: KimchiKraut K.

description: the hodori of san francisco! whoo hoo
author: Michelle D.

description: Despite the limited and cramped dining space, Cocobang does a great job with executing some great Korean dishes. The Budae Jigae is very flavorful and spicy and doesn't burn. The Fire Chicken with melted cheese is outstanding. Their selection of Pajong's are very good and not loaded with oil like most Korean restaurants serve up. The service is good but, don't expect a quick in and out dinning experience. Just sit back, relax, and order a 64oz OB beer.
author: Marco M.

description: dont really care for this place.  its for college students and mostly korean people I guess. I did like the flavored soju. The food tasted like shit
author: Tony W.

description: Mmmm, the fire chicken is actually really hot, and I really liked their calamari. Food is decent, alcohol a plenty, and open late - but I like the atmosphere at Toyose better.
author: Joanne T.

description: Awful! The tofu tasted like it was soaked in some nasty fish sauce. We wandered into here thinking we could get a decent meal, and it was awful - bad service, bad food..I am mad that I have to give this one star..I'd give it zero if possible!
author: Heidi B.

description: The name alone should have been enough to draw me into this neighborhood restaurant sooner.  I can't believe it took me this long to try it.  The only guy in there running the place was bumpin' loud music to go along with his adidas jumpsuit and he was super friendly.  We got the chicken wings that everyone's raved about and they didn't disappoint.  Their kimchi noodle soup was delicious and rivals the soup at My Tofu House.  It was super spicy and flavorful and went perfectly with a giant cold beer.  Stoked to have this place a few blocks away.
author: Victoria G.

description: The Spicy BBQ Pork was delicious. They could have offered a few more sides. Their BBQ Chicken was too sweet and not a favorite of mine. If I'm craving Korean, Steve's Korean BBQ is still worth the 30min drive to Berkeley.
author: crystal e.

description: This place is open super late which is always a big plus in this city if you're looking for fare other than nasty diner food.  The location is kinda shitty as its in the "tender nob" and can get sketchy into the wee hours of the night.  There is a parking lot right next to it which we parked at and wallked the two steps. We were seated right away even though it was a busy saturday night with a table for 5.  THe service was quick and the menu was top notch.  I got my favorite fried chicken.  We tried the duk bok gi, some kalbi, some chap jae... the usuals.  Everything was tasty and the kpop playing in the back on a loop was really entertaining.  I loved the giant bottle of HITE that we got too!
author: Tiffany L.

description: The chicken in the sauce was good, but it was a little over-priced for chicken.  I'd recommend this place mainly because it's open late and you get all the drunken korean dishes you crave.  I would go back.  Be wary of the wait as well cuz it does get packed with drunkards after hours.
author: Jonathan T.

description:
in a city that has few decent korean drinking places, this one comes through.  they have flavored soju (i'm not a huge fan of this, but usually people i go with are, so i guess it's a pseudo plus).

the food here is decent.  come on, it's a korean drinking place!  the fire chicken with cheese has always been something i've ordered.  but keep in mind, fire chicken now = hot magma you know what later . . . 

but if you need something to eat, and something to drink in tandem . . . reasonably priced and always a good time.
author: Jason J.

description: yay! somewhere to go after late night karaoke!  Good Korean food, even better when drunk!
author: Natsuko M.

description: Open real late into the night, Cocobang is an excellent late night stop for Korean food. The food was excellent, very flavorful, spicy, and fresh.  The atmosphere is very hip and has a very San Franciscan vibe to it.  The inside has a lot of brick and a large screen towards the back playing different American & Asian videos.  The place is quite small and probably doesn't have more then 12 tables so I don't recommend coming with a group larger then 6 max. The food was served pretty fast.  Portions are very generous in size and flavor!  I'd actually give Cocobang 5 stars but the service wasn't too friendly.
author: Scott S.

description:
the parking around this area is horrible, but for this place i'd gladly drive around in circles for days looking for space.

chicken wings, kimichi pancake, soondubu, and copious amounts of soju.  One pleasant surprise was the ramen in the soondubu.  Never had it like that before.

Wait staff here are super duper friendly.  Great place for a late-late night snack.
author: Jeanne L.

description: Loooove this place! The portions are big, the flavors explosive, and they really don't back down on the spicyness. This is the kind of food I live for.  And it's open late too!
author: Shumpert B.

description: I have been going to this place for a while and I think it is a very nice place to go.  Especially when I want to get some Korean drinks.  Good soju cocktail and Korean little dishes.  Some of them are just too spicy, but still taste pretty good.
author: Rex K.

description: Awesome korean bar food! Wonderful flavored soju!
author: Amy W.

description: i love the spicy rice cake (#11) on the menu here...it's flavorful & delicious!  :)  this place gets extremely packed after 2 AM...i mean it's a small spot & the tables don't clear too quickly...so if you don't want to wait i suggest going to jack in the box down the street...the place is decently priced...i think that korean food in general is overpriced...p.s. try the yogurt soju...it's great!  :)
author: Vicky C.

description: I probably shouldn't review this so highly, as my friends and I wandered in at two in the morning, perilously close to blackout drunk, and I barely remember the service or flavor. I do remember the heat -- the glorious, skin peeling heat.  Somehow my hands conspired to add hot sauce to the fire chicken before even tasting it.  The consequences of that action lasted for two days -- longer than the hangover by far.  In fact, I still walk a little funny when the weather changes.
author: Jesse M.

description: While this place doesn't serve up the most authentic Korean food, I still really like it.  I've been here about 3 or 4 times, and I always order the bimbimbap, the wonton soup, and the tangy fried chicken!  The bimbimbap is much better elsewhere (like My Tofu House), but the wonton soup is really nice and hearty.  It's hard to find Korean style fried chicken anywhere, but this place does a pretty good job.  I do think their fried chicken has too much breading.  Pretty good if you're in the neighborhood and looking for good, fulfilling asian food.  Apparently, it's also a really good late-night spot (for after or before drinking).  Decently priced.
author: Trinh N.

description: yogurt soju and rabokki, a drunk girl's best friends. this place is so fucking tits, it's amazing. open late, of course - when else would you go?
author: eve l.

description: Do NOT Misunderstand Coco Bang as a Korean restaurant.  This is a typical Korean bar.  As their name represents (in Korean), best thing  you should get is "fiery chicken" and it is very good.  People who can't handle spicy should not try it, because it is fiery, spicy, hot, burn your tongue, need to guzzle beer HOT!  If you need to test your limit, make sure to order clam soup with it.  They go well together.  Their lemon soju is very tasty.   We also had Korean blood sausage and it was little bit soupy but not bad.  I want to see more places like this open in the future.  I myself even thought about opening one!  ;P
author: Su Kyeong K.

description: The food here was pretty tasty, but definitely not in the "healthy" category.  The spicy dishes were spicy, the fried dishes fried, and everything seemed pretty authentic.  I probably wouldn't go out of my way to check it out, but if you're hard up for a bite, it's not a bad choice.
author: Patrick P.

description: Ate here once and it was wonderful.  Walk from Union Square and have some really authentic Korean food.
author: Alan H.

description: I like the atmosphere - young and hip and very Korean. Food was so-so and a little overpriced. That said, it is a cool place to take some friends, have some soju, and eat some spicy food.
author: Ben P.

description: Very disappointed in the quality of banchan and soon tofu here. I realize this is not the reason you go here...more for the drinks and fire chicken, but com'n if you serve something, even though it's not the main point, it should be decent. The Soon-tofu tasted like hot pepper paste....go chu jang and the banchan,.,even at night i could tell they were really old and not fresh.
author: Nayeoung K.

description: spicy fried chicken served with a mountain of frys ??!! YUM ^__^  if you throw up the food from here because you cant hang , you WILL hate your self in the morning ,
author: Wei W.

description: love this place!!! i kinda missed casual korean drinking places, and this is it!!!  soju & anju- that's all i ask for and that's what they have!!  of course, 'service' is good here too.  friendly staff & owner.  :)
author: E S.

description:
so you would think when you walk into a Korean place with a bunch of Korean people in it, it would be good. well, not here.
i got the bi bim bap, the spicy fried chicken, and a yogurt soju. i have had Korean food a ton of times, hell my best friend is Korean! and this place just did not cut it.
bi bim bap is traditionally made in a clay pot which i would always burn my arms by accidentally touching the side of the bowl. it usually comes with veggies, a type of meat, and a raw egg, or slightly precooked (depending where you go) on top where you mix all the ingredients together and the burning hot rice and clay bowl will cook everything.
when my bi bim bap came i was so disappointed. they served it in a plastic bowl and everything in it was lukewarm! the egg was fried, and needless to say, i was very upset to realize my Korean food craving was not going to be fulfilled.
the fried chicken was ok, nothing to embellish on there.
i think the only thing keeping me there was the soju...when in doubt, drink!
author: Rebecca Q.

description: i went there last night, the menu didn't have alot of choices and the service didn't pass for me. i'm easy to impress but for this place i'm not going back again. the food was OK but price wise i would have gone to a better korean bbq spot.
author: Jireh S.

description: i like this place, i thought the food was great. it did wreak havoc on me later on but i was a little prepared for it.  you can't put that much red pepper down your gullet without expecting some kind of chemical reaction.  i will say the beers rock and i drank a lot.  the ambiance was a little weird with all those posters of korean girls kind of staring at you.  definitely could have been a little more creative.
author: Anthony Y.
